intro: Morinda shuanghuaensis, commonly known as the double-flowered morinda, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, double-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged oppositely on the stems. The flowers are usually pink or red, adding ornamental value to gardens and natural landscapes.
